question_sentence: Maia Sandu was elected to a second term as president of which European country?
evidence: Sandu's re-election came two weeks after Moldovans voted by a razor-thin margin in favour of pursuing membership of the EU, which has been widely seen as another rebuke to Russia. Sandu, who backs closer integration with the West, has accused the Kremlin of election meddling.

question_sentence: Explosions at DHL warehouses have been linked to a Russian plan to smuggle incendiary devices on to what?
evidence: European security officials accused Russia of plotting to smuggle incendiary devices on to European planes bound for the US and Canada. This accusation came after two parcel bombs exploded at DHL logistics hubs in Leipzig, Germany, and Birmingham, England.

question_sentence: An estate owned by King Charles makes £829,000 a year from renting out what?
choices: A prison to the Ministry of Justice
evidence: The Duchy of Lancaster will make more than £11 million from a 15-year lease of warehouse space used as ambulance storage by Guy’s and St Thomas’ NHS trust. A joint investigation by The Sunday Times and Channel 4's "Dispatches" revealed how the royal duchies receive millions from public institutions.

question_sentence: Kamala Harris gave her concession speech at which university?
evidence: Kamala Harris delivered her concession speech at Howard University after congratulating Donald Trump for winning the election. In her speech, she emphasised the importance of accepting the election results while remaining committed to the causes that fuelled her campaign.

question_sentence: Rúben Amorim was confirmed as the new manager of which Premier League side?
evidence: Amorim bid farewell to Portuguese club Sporting in style with a 4-1 Champions League victory over Man City. He will step into the Old Trafford role, previously held by Erik ten Hag, on 11 November ahead of his first game – against Ipswich Town on 24 November.

question_sentence: Social media went into uproar after it was revealed that which famous pet squirrel had been euthanised?
evidence: Anger spread online after Mark Longo announced the death of his beloved pet squirrel Peanut, who had been with him for seven years. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation said Peanut had bitten an agent and had to be euthanised to test for rabies.

question_sentence: Which comic book movie passed the $300 million mark in global box office revenue this week?
evidence: The "Spiderman" spin-off sequel passed the threshold as it entered a second week at the top of the US box office. Meanwhile, "Joker: Folie à Deux" continues to underperform – after a month in cinemas, it has made just over $200 million, compared to the $1 billion-plus grossed by "Joker" in 2019.

question_sentence: The largest Boeing union strike has ended with a contract agreement after how many weeks?
evidence: The union ended a seven-week strike after 59% of its 26,000 voting members approved Boeing’s fourth offer. The deal includes a 38% pay raise over four years, a $12,000 signing bonus and additional benefits.

question_sentence: Australia's prime minister announced that under-16s would be banned from what?
evidence: Anthony Albanese's proposal would keep under-16s from having accounts on platforms like Instagram, TikTok or YouTube even if they have parental consent. The legislation, designed to address concerns about the harmful impact of social media on young people, would put the onus on tech companies to enforce the ban.

question_sentence: Israel's Defence Minister Yoav Gallant was dismissed and replaced by which controversial cabinet member?
evidence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired Defence Minister Yoav Gallant because of significant disagreements over the handling of Israel's war in Gaza. Netanyahu appointed Foreign Minister Israel Katz, a loyalist with little military experience, to replace him.

question_sentence: Which famous Hollywood car did Damian Muzzi of Delaware Star Cars replicate?
choices: The DeLorean from "Back to the Future"

question_sentence: Who made history by becoming the first openly transgender person elected to the United States Congress?
What was the historic settlement reached in Delaware regarding Mark Purnell?
choices: A new trial for his case
A public apology from the state

question_sentence: How many food dishes were featured at the Annakut festival in New Castle?
Which two schools won titles at the New Castle County cross-country championships?
What was a major concern voiced by Wilmington voters during the general election?
What did Delaware nonprofits seek more support for in 2024?
Which Delaware brand was praised by Sean "Diddy" Combs?
What was the outcome of banning cellphones in Delaware schools?
What was highlighted in the article about Delaware and Rhode Island football matchups?
When will Donald Trump be sworn in as the 47th president of the United States?
evidence: President-elect Donald Trump will take office on January 20, 2025. Throughout November, December and January, there will be a transition between the outgoing administration of President Joe Biden and the incoming Trump administration.

question_sentence: How many electoral votes are needed to win the US presidency?
evidence: It takes at least 270 electoral votes to win the presidency. Donald Trump surpassed 270 with wins in the battleground states of Georgia, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.

question_sentence: Vice President Kamala Harris officially conceded the 2024 race on Wednesday while committing to a peaceful transfer of power. Where did she deliver her concession speech?
evidence: Harris gave her concession speech at Howard University, her alma mater, in Washington, DC. She accepted the results of the election and promised to keep up the “fight that fueled this campaign.”

question_sentence: New data confirms 2024 will be the hottest year on record. Which climate agreement did Donald Trump vow to pull the US out of?
evidence: Nearly all the world's countries pledged to strive to keep global warming under 1.5 degrees Celsius in the Paris Agreement. Trump, a noted climate denier, pulled the US out of the Paris Agreement during his first term and has vowed to do it again in his second.

question_sentence: Which state issued evacuation orders for thousands of residents due to “life-threatening” wildfire conditions?
evidence: Thousands evacuated California’s Ventura County this week after the Mountain Fire burned into neighborhoods. Red flag warnings, which alert residents about dangerous fire weather conditions, were in place for millions of others across the state.

question_sentence: What could soon be the minimum age for social media users in Australia?
evidence: Australia’s prime minister is working to legislate a “world-leading” social media ban for children under 16. The restrictions would ban underage users from accessing certain platforms, including Instagram and TikTok.

question_sentence: This viral breakdancer announced that she will retire following backlash over her Paris Olympics performance. What is her stage name?
evidence: Rachael “Raygun” Gunn declared she will no longer compete after facing online hatred over her viral Olympic performance. She became an overnight sensation after losing all three of her round-robin battles by a combined score of 54-0 when breaking made its Olympic debut.

question_sentence: A costly strike recently ended at which company?
evidence: Striking workers at embattled plane maker Boeing voted Monday to accept the company’s most recent offer, ending the costliest strike in the US in more than 25 years.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 114,000 cars this week due to airbag safety concerns?
evidence: Volkswagen recalled thousands of vehicles over concerns about airbags exploding due to long-term exposure to humidity and high temperatures.

question_sentence: Which NBA team recently recorded the best start to a season in franchise history?
evidence: The Cleveland Cavaliers have made a historic 9-0 start this season, surpassing the 8-0 start made by the franchise’s 1976-77 team.
